description: The Escrow Assistant will support the Escrow Officer in managing all aspects of the escrow process. This role involves handling administrative tasks, coordinating with various stakeholders, and ensuring the smooth and timely closing of real estate transactions. Key Responsibilities: Assist Escrow Officer with opening, processing, and closing escrow files. Prepare and review escrow documents, including contracts, amendments, and closing statements. Communicate with buyers, sellers, real estate agents, lenders, and other parties involved in the transaction. Ensure all necessary documents are completed, signed, and returned in a timely manner. Maintain accurate and organized escrow files and records. Coordinate the scheduling of closings and ensure all conditions are met before closing. Handle disbursement of funds and ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements. Provide exceptional customer service and address any inquiries or concerns from clients.

benefits: Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.
